lines.line: Did it ever happen? Sure it happened. It happened, I'm not crazy it's here,
(pointing to head) all here, in my memory-yeah. Yeah I- arrive at the Bloor Street
Viaduct, and uh--- yeah, I see the wall. I walk...walk.. extruheemly slowly towards the
wall, my legs...shaking..and climb up. I look down and...I don't want to jump on the
cars, and cause other deaths, so I...move..along I see my face when they find me-no
marks just one long yellow bruise there (temple)...(steps sideways)- I..hear that sound.
Ever been in a geriatrics ward in the middle of the night? (They all) A grind (their) my
teeth- (that's what it sounded like) This grinding teeth sound. Then, and then the drum
sound, as if the whole city knew, boom boom boom boom boom BOOM BOOM BOOM
BOOM BOOM BOOM........(small strange voice) "I'm not gonna hurt you." (turns quickly)
Who's that? A cop? There's nobody! Just ahhhhh! A white dog! Beside me!
How did it..
"YOU'RE JUMPING TO HELL" the dog, the dog spoke.
So I answered--
"BUT I'M LIVING IN HELL...ANYWAY."
"YOU'RE LIVING IN HELL, CAUSE YOU AINT DONE YOUR MISSION."
"What's that?"
"TO SAVE YOUR FATHER FROM DEATH. TO SAVE YOUR FATHER
FROM DEATH."
The dog...spoke!!! I-My father? My father, to me, was just a (sick) old man we had
dinner with once a month (since my mother left him a couple years ago); he he'd cook up
some chops and we'd sit around and...try to think of something to say...he-way dying,
but all fathers die. I just didn't...think..much about it, I
OUT OF THE TUNNEL
